page.title: 14A NEW HOUSE IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: "About two years ago my Mum and Dad put in plans to the local planning department for a house on our four acre field.They were not accepted so after along time they put it to appeal and were told yes,so we could begin. The land is an landslide(the landslide was in the ice-age)so we had to ask geologist he said yes so we began.We had to have metal bars in the ground to make it stronger. Chelnor Building Ltd built the shell of the house then we built the roof on ourselves.We put the felt then the batterns then the tiles then the lead around the chimneys. At last we started on the inside.We had to get some-one in to do plastering then we did the floors.We put this black paint-like thing on,then we put blue plastic on, and floor boards. by Juliet Burridge
